Some Lesser Known Facts About Sumeet Raghavan

Does Sumeet Raghavan smoke?: Not Known

Does Sumeet Raghavan drink alcohol?: Yes

Sumeet Raghavan was born to a Tamil father and a Kannada mother.

Since his childhood, he was interested in singing and went on to receive training in classical music from Pt. Vasantrao Kulkarni and Suresh Wadkar.

He mostly likes to sing ghazals and soft Hindi songs.

At the age of just 8, Sumeet Raghavan started acting and has performed at various stage shows.

He has worked in two languages, Hindi and Marathi.

In 1986, he joined a theatre in Mumbai and his first play was ‘Mala Bhet Havi Ho’ for which he won the Most Promising Child Actor Award.

Sumeet has also done numerous famous Hindi and Marathi plays like ‘Rang Umalatya Manache,’ ‘Jwalamukhi,’ ‘Lekure Udanda Jahali,’ etc.

He made his first on-screen appearance as a child artist in 1983 by playing the lead role of Faster Fene in the TV serial ‘Faster Fene.’

In 2007, he participated in the famous Marathi singing reality TV show ‘Sa Re Ga Ma Pa’ that was aired on Zee Marathi, in which he was one of the finalists.

In 2008, Sumeet won the Hindi singing reality TV show ‘Say Shava Shava’ that was aired on NDTV Imagine.

He also participated in another Hindi singing reality TV show ‘Star Ya Rockstar’ in 2011 that was aired on Zee TV.

He received huge fame with his role of Sahil Sarabhai in the TV serial ‘Sarabhai vs Sarabhai.’

Sumeet Raghavan has worked in some short films like ‘Reincarnation,’ etc.

He has also worked as a dubbing artist for Hollywood films like Blue Streak (1999), Shanghai Noon (2000), Rush Hour 2 (2001), Harry Potter & the Chamber of Secrets (2002), and Shanghai Knights (2003).

He has been featured in numerous TV commercials like Cadbury Celebrations, Dabur Balm, New Tata Sky Plus, Bru Coffee, ICICI Mobile Banking, Seagram’s Imperial Blue, etc.

Apart from being an actor, Sumeet is also a famous host and has hosted several web shows and TV shows like ‘Jay Hind!’ (2009-2013), ‘Jhalak Dikhhla Ja Season 4’ (2010), ‘The Late Night Show – Jitna Rangeen Utna Sangeen’ (2012), and ‘India Ke Mast Kalandar’ (2018).
